name: Best Ever Irish Soda Bread
author: Tricia
summary: A moist, cake-like Irish Soda Bread that's not just for St. Paddy's Day... it's so easy and sooo delicious you'll be craving it all year 'round.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, at room temperature
1 ½ cups buttermilk, at room temperature
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Stir together the flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda in a large bowl
Using a pastry cutter, cut the butter gently into the flour mixture until well combined, and stir in the raisins
In another bowl, whisk the buttermilk and eggs together; lightly beat the buttermilk mixture into the flour mixture
Place the dough into the prepared cake pan
Bake in the preheated oven until the bread has risen and the top is golden brown, 45 minutes to 1 hour
A knife inserted into the center of the bread should come out clean
Cool the bread in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes before removing
